Package dev.gamekit.animation

Class Animation

java.lang.Object
dev.gamekit.animation.Animation
public class Animation extends Object
Animation holds a value which increments from 0 to 1 over some duration. The value can then be connected to any property for smooth transitions.

Animation can be set to run once or repeat (either restart or alternate). Additionally, an AnimationCurve can be attached to change how the animation's value is interpolated.

    • setStateListener

      public Animation setStateListener(Animation.StateListener listener)
      Sets the state listener and returns this animation

    • setValueListener

      public Animation setValueListener(Animation.ValueListener listener)
      Sets the value listener and returns this animation

    • start

      public void start()
      Starts / Restarts this animation and changes its state to Animation.State.RUNNING

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Stops and resets this animation by changing its state to Animation.State.STOPPED and its value to 0. Stopped animations can be restarted by calling start()

    • end

      public void end()
      Ends this animation and changes its state to Animation.State.ENDED. Ended animations are removed from the engine and cannot be restarted.

    • isEnded

      public boolean isEnded()

    • update

      public void update()
      Called internally by the application game loop to update this animation
